loop_intent: Progressively discover and map execution environment through successive runs, each exploring a different aspect and building cumulative knowledge
progression_evidence: Act section explicitly states: 'explore one aspect', 'Each run adds to your map', 'Remember: You're an explorer mapping unknown territory'. Reflection section guides: 'decide what aspect of the environment to explore next', 'avoid redundant exploration'. The loop saves findings in append mode to 'exploration_log.md' to build cumulative knowledge.
result_pattern_evidence: Runs 2-5 all PASSED with successful explorations. Run 6 FAILED with BrokenPipe error (possibly transient). Run 7 (current) FAILED with NameError due to code logic bug (failure_types undefined). The verification scores dropped dramatically: Discovery Value 3/10, Insight Depth 2/10, Efficiency 1/10, Overall 2.0/10 (vs threshold 5.0). Code attempted to explore execution_learning but crashed before completing analysis.
code_quality_rationale: Current code has a critical variable scope bug (failure_types not initialized when execution_learning directory is empty). Code crashed mid-execution preventing any meaningful exploration. This is run #7 but code attempted to explore the same execution_learning area that likely was already covered in earlier successful runs.
rationale: STRONG REGENERATION NEEDED for three critical reasons: (1) This is an exploratory/discovery loop designed for progressive learning - each run MUST explore different territory, but deterministic code will repeat same exploration. (2) Code has a logic bug (NameError on undefined variable) that will persist - not a transient failure. (3) This is run #7 of an exploratory loop - fresh code generation can select genuinely NEW exploration areas based on what's already in exploration_log.md and avoid repeating territory. The verification explicitly states: 'explore genuinely NEW territory' and 'choose a completely different area'. Cached code defeats the entire purpose of progressive discovery.
